alert.note: Alert for Forsyth (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 06 at 12:58AM EDT until April 06 at 9:01AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Georgia... Big Creek near Cumming affecting Forsyth County. For the Big Creek...including Cumming...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Big Creek near Cumming. * WHEN...Until late Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 7 feet, Minor flooding continues to expand into the natural flood plain of the creek upstream and downstream from the gage at Atlanta Highway or Georgia Highway 9. Large portions of the sidewalk and boardwalk of the Big Creek Greenway will be flooded. The areas under the Georgia 400 Highway and McFarland Road will be covered with around two feet of water. A portion of the sidewalk under Majors Road will be covered with around 3 feet of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:45 PM EDT Tuesday the stage was 7 feet and falling. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 6 feet. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
